reviews.review: Amazing - even better than the first!

I was never a massive fan of the original Frozen movie. I like it, for sure, but it pales in comparison to other Disney animated films in almost every category. It's a film completely overshadowed by its soundtrack, and on its own is just a fairly typical Disney Princess story. But it's still entertaining, and I'll watch it if it's on. The sequel looks and sounds just as good as its predecessor but is largely inferior in most other categories. The story is convoluted, the writing is dull, the comedy is weak and the ending is shamelessly contrived. It's an attempt to have it both ways, making a sacrifice to gain a reward without actually having to lose anything to do so. It's clear that the story was the last thing on the developer's minds, as they needed to gets the music and set pieces sorted out first. As such, the plot is simply a device to get the leads from one song to the next. A lot of Anna and Elsa's interactions are just petty arguments, and the romance between Anna and Kristoff is marred with clumsy misunderstandings which the film passes off as ‘complications of love'. It feels like a sequel that was made because the first one was successful, not because there was a good reason to continue the story, and while it'll easily kill at the box office, that's all down to its predecessors legacy, not its objective quality.
It was a joyful amazing movie for all ages!

The music in this Frozen movie ranged from okay to down-right awful. Kristoff has a particularly 80s-esque music number that was painful to watch. 

On the positive, the movie writers did a good job of building some mythology for the magic with which Elsa is born. I don't understand how the element of Fire some how became an animal side- kick,  but my daughter thought it was cute. 

Overall, though, my 3-year-old did not like the movie because,  "Elsa's eyes went BOOM!" I'm not sure what that means, but I have no reason to contradict her assessment.
It was really great! Almost as good as the first one.

The songs were bad and there were a lot of them. The whole plot is about self discovery again and Elsa’s emotion conflicts. It’s a bad plot with no real enemies. Nothing but girl power messages through the whole movie. Boys matter too! It just wasn’t very good. However, it was clean but a little dark.

I expect this is a movie everyone will watch just because of the first.  I have to say, though, that I didn't love it.    It was dark, both visually and thematically, compared to the first.   There were parts that seemed to drag a little.   Some of Olaf's jokes were not actually funny - I would expect more from the writers.   I also felt like there were some dots that needed connecting regarding the spirits in general and the 5th spirit and what it/she actually was.  What is Elsa's new purpose?   And how was her mother calling her with an audible voice?  Some loose ends that needed tying up.   There was also dynamic lacking between Christoph and Anna in the middle of the movie.  Again, lots of loose ends.  Overall, I just felt its was lacking in many areas.
The 2nd Frozen aged well with my daughter. New songs are ok. The storyline was well done.
The storyline was impressive.  Graphics and music phenomenal!  Enjoyed by both kids and adults. Great message.
